channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Noem announces pause on immigrant visa lottery that allowed alleged Brown shooter to enter US
item.description: DHS Sec. Kristi Noem announced a pause on the Diversity Immigrant Visa lottery, saying that the Brown University shooting perpetrator entered the coun...

item.title: The Lessons of Wild Reeds
item.description: Thirty years of triangulating film and cultural insight.

item.title: Meta’s 28-year-old billionaire prodigy says the next Bill Gates will be a 13-year-old who is ‘vibe coding’ right now
item.description: Teenagers, Alexandr Wang argues, have a built-in edge.

item.title: The Week: Trump’s Affordability Address
item.description: Plus: A massacre on Bondi Beach.

item.title: Trump signs massive $901 billion defense policy bill into law
item.description: President Trump signed the National Defense Authorization Act into law Thursday, ensuring the Pentagon gets a whopping $901 billion for fiscal year 20...

item.title: Rubio unloads on ‘alarmists,’ touts State Dept disaster response after USAID closure
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio defended USAID closure, citing Hurricane Melissa response in Jamaica as proof critics were wrong about disaster aid.

item.title: Kathy Hochul Chooses Death
item.description: New York’s governor didn’t need to legalize medically assisted suicide.

item.title: The new American Dream has parents easing up on college expectations for their kids—1 in 3 are now open to trade school instead
item.description: “Parents are waking up,” career strategist says. “College doesn’t carry the same [return on investment] it once did.”

item.title: Conservatives’ Health Care Conundrum
item.description: The only way to meaningfully reduce health care costs is to make people more sensitive to them.

item.title: The CEO behind the world’s top sleep and meditation app says most leaders are operating at ‘about 20%’ without a ‘fully recharged’ battery
item.description: David Ko said most executives will say they’re good when you ask how they are. Some additional interrogation suggests the opposite is true.

item.title: Michigan Democrat Candidate Fantasizes About Hurling Beers At Justices Barrett, Kavanaugh

item.title: BBDO International CEO: The biggest risks are the ones not taken
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: US military strikes narco-terrorist vessels in latest Eastern Pacific drug trafficking operation
item.description: U.S. forces kill five narco-terrorists in Eastern Pacific strike as Joint Task Force targets drug trafficking vessels in latest military operation.

item.title: Sneaking unemployment rate means the U.S. economy is inching closer to a key recession indicator, says Moody’s
item.description: "The trends are not our friends here," said Moody's economist Cris deRitis.

item.title: North Carolina's longest-serving governor dies at 88 after serving 4 terms in office
item.description: Former North Carolina Gov. Jim Hunt, who served a record 16 years and championed education, has died at 88 years old, his daughter announced.

item.title: Employment Commission Makes Direct Appeal To White Males Facing Workplace Discrimination
item.description: The Trump administration's Equal Employment Opportunity Commission is launching an assault on DEI discrimination against white men.

item.title: Is Populism Popular?
item.description: As ever, ‘generic Republican’ is still the most potent political brand in America.

item.description: Nigeria is the epicenter of the fight for jihadist control and the imposition of sharia law over all of Africa.
